groups.title: Standard Top Lead - importers for BBC homepage

items.headline: All Blacks beat Wallabies in Wellington

90947201.altText: The New Zealand defence wraps up Australia's Michael Hooper

items.summary: World champions New Zealand retain the Bledisloe Cup with a 29-9 victory against Australia in Wellington.

items.headline: Olympic medallist leaves Harlequins
items.summary: Ollie Lindsay-Hague, who won a silver medal in the rugby sevens with Great Britain at the Olympics, leaves Harlequins.

items.headline: Ex-rugby man foils robbers with tea mug
items.overtypedHeadline: Ex-England player foils robbers in Malta
items.summary: A 78-year-old former England rugby player foils a robbery attempt by three men, chasing them out of his house in Malta armed only with a mug of tea.

items.headline: Piutau shines as Ulster defeat Saints

90944737.altText: Charles Piutau makes a surging run against Northampton Saints

items.overtypedHeadline: Piutau shines as Ulster beat Northampton in friendly
items.summary: Charles Piutau inspires Ulster to a 29-19 friendly victory over Northampton Saints on his home debut.

items.headline: World Rugby chief open to GB sevens teams

90933457.altText: Team GB men celebrate silver at the Rio Olympics

items.overtypedHeadline: World Rugby chief Gosper open to GB sevens team in world series
items.overtypedSummary: Brett Gosper is open to the idea of GB teams playing in the world sevens series, rather than separate home nations as presently.
items.summary: Brett Gosper is open to the idea of GB teams playing in the world sevens series, rather than separate home nations as presently.

items.headline: Blackadder 'watched 63 Bath games' to prepare
items.summary: New Bath director of rugby Todd Blackadder says he watched all their games from the past two years to help him prepare.

items.headline: Clubs fear impact of Willis legal case
items.overtypedHeadline: Premiership bosses fear impact of concussion legal case
items.summary: Premiership bosses say Cillian Willis' legal action against Sale could have wider repercussions for rugby.

items.headline: Robinson signs new Bristol deal to 2019
items.summary: Director of rugby Andy Robinson signs a new three-year contract with newly-promoted Premiership club Bristol until 2019.

items.headline: Welsh exiles set to miss out - Phillips
items.summary: High-profile Wales players will miss out on Test selection this autumn under the so called Gatland's Law, says WRU chief Martyn Phillips.
